pr_title: SONARJAVA-3412 Rule S5840: Regex patterns and their sub-patterns should not always fail

timeline.message: Check whether anchors are used where they cannot match
Check whether anchors are used where they cannot match

timeline.bodyText:
As a general observation, I believe it's better to test the message/location only when it "matters". It will avoid having to change it everywhere if you change it, and easily spot in which case you expect something different.
For example here, testing the location each time makes sense, however, testing the message seems redundant.
timeline.author: quentin-jaquier-sonarsource

timeline.bodyText: Can't we start from the end, and return as soon as we find a consuming index, to avoid useless computation?
timeline.author: quentin-jaquier-sonarsource

timeline.bodyText: I think we are missing a test with both boundary and backreference that can never match, to test that we have one issue for both.
timeline.author: quentin-jaquier-sonarsource

timeline.bodyText: It might be personal taste/formatting, but to me, an empty line between variables "means something". For example, keeping groupCount  separated make sense since it relates to invalid BackReference detection, but it would make sense to groups these together.
timeline.author: quentin-jaquier-sonarsource
